resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
mqy opened a new pull request #9058:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9058


   https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8936 updated crate `flatbuffers` to 0.8.0 , but function `get_arrow_schema_from_metadata` still returning `Option` rather than `Result`. This PR fixes this issue.

jorgecarleitao commented on a change in pull request #9058:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9058#discussion_r550747754



##########
File path: rust/parquet/src/arrow/schema.rs
##########
@@ -42,12 +42,17 @@ pub fn parquet_to_arrow_schema(
     key_value_metadata: &Option<Vec<KeyValue>>,
 ) -> Result<Schema> {
     let mut metadata = parse_key_value_metadata(key_value_metadata).unwrap_or_default();
-    let arrow_schema_metadata = metadata
+    let maybe_schema = metadata
         .remove(super::ARROW_SCHEMA_META_KEY)
         .map(|encoded| get_arrow_schema_from_metadata(&encoded));
 
+    let arrow_schema_metadata = match maybe_schema {

Review comment:
       There may be an idiom for this in rust (that I do not know).

   BTW, I found some similar usage of `map_or` in `parquet/src/column/writer.rs` 🥇

Dandandan commented on a change in pull request #9058:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9058#discussion_r550752212



##########
File path: rust/parquet/src/arrow/schema.rs
##########
@@ -42,14 +42,10 @@ pub fn parquet_to_arrow_schema(
     key_value_metadata: &Option<Vec<KeyValue>>,
 ) -> Result<Schema> {
     let mut metadata = parse_key_value_metadata(key_value_metadata).unwrap_or_default();
-    let maybe_schema = metadata
+    let arrow_schema_metadata = metadata
         .remove(super::ARROW_SCHEMA_META_KEY)
-        .map(|encoded| get_arrow_schema_from_metadata(&encoded));
-
-    let arrow_schema_metadata = match maybe_schema {
-        Some(v) => Some(v?),
-        _ => None,
-    };
+        .map(|encoded| get_arrow_schema_from_metadata(&encoded))
+        .map_or(Ok(None), |v| v.map(Some))?;

Review comment:
       I think this can use unwrap_or, as both of the cases map to Ok?

mqy commented on a change in pull request #9058:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9058#discussion_r550756009



##########
File path: rust/parquet/src/arrow/schema.rs
##########
@@ -42,14 +42,10 @@ pub fn parquet_to_arrow_schema(
     key_value_metadata: &Option<Vec<KeyValue>>,
 ) -> Result<Schema> {
     let mut metadata = parse_key_value_metadata(key_value_metadata).unwrap_or_default();
-    let maybe_schema = metadata
+    let arrow_schema_metadata = metadata
         .remove(super::ARROW_SCHEMA_META_KEY)
-        .map(|encoded| get_arrow_schema_from_metadata(&encoded));
-
-    let arrow_schema_metadata = match maybe_schema {
-        Some(v) => Some(v?),
-        _ => None,
-    };
+        .map(|encoded| get_arrow_schema_from_metadata(&encoded))
+        .map_or(Ok(None), |v| v.map(Some))?;

Review comment:
       @Dandandan thanks a lot!  The code looks more concise!
